li: We've identified reason-for-citing (RFC) passages in our documents and provided an Activate Passages button that makes them visible.
When selected, these passages connect you to cases that directly cite your case, as well as those your case cites.
Some of these cases might not be in your original search results, which can provide a more thorough set of results related to your topic than your original search yielded.

p: After running a search and opening a relevant document, select the "Activate Passages" button. Activated passages appear with an outline and the display jumps to the document’s first RFC passage. The Navigate menu changes to Passages so you can step forward or backward through activated passages.

p: Cases appear in order depending on how similar their passages are to your case’s passage. You can sort the documents in other ways using the Sort menu, or by selecting a column header.
You can mark documents to save to a work folder using the checkboxes and Folder icon.
And you can view documents in "Details" view, which shows a portion of each document; or you can select "List" view, which shows more cases without scrolling.
